Warm-up (2-3 min)

.e review:

I and you go → ?
Alice and Bob are happy → ?

(Answers: mi .e do cu klama, la .alis. .e la .bob. cu gleki)

New Material (5-7 min)

New Vocabulary

Lojban Place Structure English
pagbu x1 is a part/component of x2 part/component
stura x1 is a structure of x2 structure

The Four Sumti Connectives

Cmavo Meaning Logic
.e and both true
.a or at least one true
.o iff same truth value
.u whether or not independent

Using .a (Or)

mi .a do cu klama

I or you go (or both). — At least one of us goes.

la .alis. .a la .bob. cu tavla

Alice or Bob talks (or both).

Using .o (If and Only If)

mi .o do cu klama

I go if and only if you go. — We both go, or neither goes.

Using .u (Whether or Not)

mi .u do cu klama

I go whether or not you go. — My going is independent of yours.

Key Point

.a is inclusive or (at least one). .o means same status. .u means independent.
sections.title: New Material (5-7 min)

sections.content:
Practice (4-5 min)

Exercise 1: Choose the Connective

Fill in the blank:

  1. "I or you go (at least one)." → mi ___ do cu klama
  2. "I and you go (both)." → mi ___ do cu klama
  3. "I go iff you go." → mi ___ do cu klama
Answers
  1. .a
  2. .e
  3. .o

Exercise 2: Translate

  1. Alice or Bob is happy.
  2. The dog and cat are big.
  3. I go whether or not you go.
Answers
  1. la .alis. .a la .bob. cu gleki
  2. lo gerku .e lo mlatu cu barda
  3. mi .u do cu klama

Exercise 3: New Vocabulary

Translate:

  1. This is a part of the system.
  2. The structure is big.
  3. I see a part.
Answers
  1. ti pagbu lo ciste
  2. lo stura cu barda
  3. mi viska lo pagbu

sections.content:
Conversation Challenge (1-2 min)

Say aloud:

  1. "You or I talk." → mi .a do cu tavla
  2. "I go iff you go." → mi .o do cu klama
  3. "This is a part." → ti pagbu

Today's Vocab

Lojban English
pagbu part/component
stura structure

Grammar:

Cmavo Function
.e and (both)
.a or (at least one)
.o iff (same truth)
.u whether or not (independent)

Summary

You learned all four sumti connectives: .e (and), .a (or), .o (iff), .u (whether or not).
